title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Strictly Come Dancing's Aljaz Skorjanec gets injured Lady Weymouth back on feet
text:
Winner of the dance-off last weekend, Viscountess Weymouth is determined to remain on Strictly Come Dancing.

Emma — who is married to Longleat heir Ceawlin Thynn, the Marquess of Bath's son — has been practising her dance moves with Strictly partner Aljaz Skorjanec, 29, even during breaks from rehearsals near her stately home in Wiltshire.

As my exclusive pictures show, Lady Weymouth, 33, took handsome Aljaz's hand as they twirled outside a village hall before studying his mobile phone.

Emma (pictured with Strictly partner Aljaz Skorjanec, 29) suffered a foot injury during her performance last weekend

Emma hopes her Viennese Waltz tonight, to the Whitney Houston hit Saving All My Love For You, will still impress both the judges and public

Emma suffered a foot injury during her performance last weekend and hopes her Viennese Waltz tonight, to the Whitney Houston hit Saving All My Love For You, will still impress both the judges and public.

She said: 'I'm hoping that it will click back into place and I'll be able to Waltz to Whitney with all the poise and grace worthy of this beautiful dance.'

A Frosty blast for BBC over Essex girl Gemma

Mariella Frostrup has attacked the BBC for recruiting reality star Gemma Collins at the same time as it's slashing Radio 4's budget.

'I can recognise the scent of desperation when it wafts past,' she says. 'I've got nothing against Gemma Collins.

'However, as a licence-fee payer, I have reservations about where my money is being spent. Alienating your core audience is a strange way of doing business.'

Bosses shouldn't worry about attracting listeners under 30: 'They'll instinctively turn to what the BBC offers once they're no longer preoccupied with socialising seven nights a week and saving the planet.'

Mariella adds: 'Audiences are like lovers — if you chase them, they run away. Remain true to yourself and they'll come running when the time is right.'

Mariella Frostrup has attacked the BBC for recruiting reality star Gemma Collins (pictured) at the same time as it's slashing Radio 4's budget

Celebrated actress Eileen Atkins complains that she's the only theatrical dame of her vintage who hasn't been invited to lunch with the Queen at Sandringham.

Dames Judi Dench, Maggie Smith, Diana Rigg and Joan Plowright have visited the Norfolk retreat, prompting Dame Eileen to ask a friend who looks after the Queen's horses why that invitation has failed to arrive.

'He looked at me and said, 'Bit of a loose cannon, you are, Eileen.' She laughs: 'Well, I suppose that's true.'

authors: Richard Eden For The Daily Mail
